title: Here's How To Live The Smart Life With These 5 Must-Have Gadgets In Your Home
text:
Remember the 90s, when we fought with our siblings over the TV remote? Now, each one of us simply controls the television on our smartphones – that’s how much life has changed in the millennium. And while some of us are still getting the hang of living the smart life, every day there is an invention out there that is making our life a lot more comfortable.

If you want the full tech upgrade to the millennium home, we have a list of the basic must-have gadgets your smart home needs.

OnePlus TV

CNET

What does all the furniture in the room point to? Every home needs an entertainment system that the family can gather around to spend time together and that smart device is the latest OnePlus TV. The first flagship models OnePlus Q1 and Q1 Pro are already quite a rage. The 55” inch smart TV has a superior design with a nearly bezel-less screen. It also features the latest 4K QLED display that assures vividly attractive and crisp visuals. That’s not all, besides the HDR display quality, the OnePlus TV also has 8 Dolby Atmos speakers with a 50W output to fill the living room with audio.

Now comes the more interesting features of the OnePlus TV – Android TV platform and Google Assistant. From streaming your favourite shows to going “Hey Google, what’s trending today?” you can enjoy it all!

Amazon Echo/Google Home

digitaltrends.com

From controlling all your smart devices to recommending the best take-out restaurants around you, these smart devices do it all at one command. What’s more, they’ll book you a cab, dim the lights in the room, tell you the news and weather updates and will even play music! It’s like having your very own millennial robot butler at your service.

Air Purifier

The Verge

Going by the current air quality in India, we think it’s about time each house has a cool gadget like an air purifier that filters the air and removes the harmful pollutants and allergens. It’s easy to change the filter of the purifier now and then. You can also use the purifier to cool the room in the summer heat.

Smart Switch Panels

imore.com

The first thing you need to add are smart bulbs and smart switch panels to make your home the hub of smart life. Switching them with the latest remote-controlled bulbs will make your life a lot easier. One remote (even your smartphone) will control it all without you having to worry about leaving the lights on in the next room.

Smart Home Security System

techhive.com

If your parents live alone in the city, it’s best to upgrade their security system with the smarter and latest models that offer clear visuals and audio and even send out an alarm upon forced entry.
